private_settings.description:
Do you want to let CopperCrm update links between Users and Accounts in Hull? Be careful about conflicts with other connectors that would link users too.

**IMPORTANT:** when this checkbox is checked the connector will create a Hull Account for EVERY CopperCrm Account any Prospect is linked to (refer to documentation for more details).

settings_sections.title: Connect with CopperCrm
settings_sections.description: The following information is required in order to connect with your CopperCrm instance.

settings_sections.title: Lead - Identity
settings_sections.description:
Identity is one of the most important concepts in Hull. The field mapping for user identity should correspond to unique fields across systems. This identity applies to both the data we send to CopperCrm as well as the data we pull from CopperCrm. To read more about identity resolution please click [here](https://help.hull.io/hc/en-us/articles/360030051471 "Identity Resolution Explained")

Email is typically a fairly stable identifier, but can be vulnerable to edge cases. Ideally there is an unique identifier (external_id) that can be used across systems. Try to configure the identity before doing anything else. Changes to the identity after the data flow is already setup could result in irreconcilable scenarios.

settings_sections.title: User - Fetching Users from CopperCrm
settings_sections.description:
Hull gives it's customers the ability to capture changes on specific data fields so that they are kept up to date in real-time. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from CopperCrm below.

Add a mapping by clicking "Map an attribute". To create a new attribute in Hull, you may type in the attribute name in the "Hull Attribute" box on the right and hit enter to create a new attribute.
